channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Stocks Surge, Bonds Tumble on Trump Win in U.S. Election
item.description: U.S. stock indexes jumped, led by the Dow industrials, with investors piling into trades that align with a second Trump presidency.

item.title: What's Driving the Strong Market Reaction to Trump Win
item.description: Investors believe they have a handle on what Donald Trump will do this time. But it’s not obvious that they are any better at assessing politics, or t...

item.title: Why Trump’s tax cuts and tariff plans could face roadblocks from bond markets
item.description: Surging 10-year Treasury yields could temper Trump administration plans that risk growing the large U.S. deficit.

item.title: What a second Trump term means for retirement
item.description: Congress may have more impact than the president when it comes to retirement.

item.title: Surge in Dollar Hits Commodity Prices
item.description: The U.S. dollar index was on track to see its largest uptick since March 2020 on Trump’s election win. Spectra Markets sees turbulence ahead for globa...

item.title: Super Micro Is Coming Up Too Short
item.description: Disappointing server sales are blamed on the delay of new Nvidia chip, but management’s credibility has dimmed.

item.title: This chart shows just when voters started getting upset about the economy
item.description: MarketWatch ran a regression of key economic variables, against the long-running University of Michigan consumer-sentiment index, to see if attitudes ...

item.title: Trump's Comeback Reverberates Through Markets
item.description: Stock futures rose sharply along with the dollar, bond yields and bitcoin, after investors piled into “Trump trades.”

item.title: Tesla’s stock is soaring on Trump’s win. Here’s why Wall Street is so upbeat.
item.description: CEO Elon Musk has close ties to Trump. Plus, Tesla could benefit from potential higher Chinese tariffs, an analyst says.

item.title: ‘It strikes me as vengeful’: My friend wants to boycott a coffee shop because of the owner’s political views. Is this what America has become?
item.description: “There was a pile-on of hate and jubilance at the thought of putting this man out of business.”
